name: goosegrass
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a plant with small, white flowers and prickly (= with thin, sharp points that stick out), sticky stems, and fruits that stay attached to any surface they touch, which is used as a herb to treat medical conditions: The garden had been overtaken by chickweed and goosegrass. The sticky stems and seeds of the goosegrass clung to his clothing.
More examplesFewer examplesAnother great way to spread seeds are the hooks of burdock, goosegrass, and wood avens.Goosegrass appeared among the pea plants in June, but was quickly and easily dealt with.The strong, extensive root system means that goosegrass often invades hard, compacted soils found in high traffic areas.
